intro: Nototriche auricoma, commonly known as the auricoma nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silver-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its small yellow flowers bloom in the spring and are arranged in dense clusters, making it an attractive ornamental plant. Nototriche auricoma is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping in drought-prone areas.
